title: Grenfell re-housing 'not good enough' - BBC News
summary: commons begins with culture questions from 9.30am .
sitting opens with minute 's silence for westminster attack victims .
this afternoon : general debate on the economy .

documents.title: summary : thursday in parliament
text: housing secretary sajid javid made a commons statement to brief mps about today 's report from the official grenfell recovery task force nine months after the fire .
mr javid said it was unlikely that all households will have been permanently housed by the first anniversary of the tragedy in june .
he told mps it was `` clearly not good enough '' and that `` living for this long in hotels can only make the process of grieving and recovery even longer '' .
labour 's tony lloyd criticised the local council - the royal borough of kensington and chelsea - for its lack of `` zeal '' in dealing with the problem .
he called it a `` shameful record '' that nine months on 209 families needed rehousing .
meanwhile there was a row in the house of lords when leaver and remainer peers teamed up to challenge a minister on reports that uk passports will be made abroad .
lord forsyth and lord foulkes tried to force a debate on a statutory instrument on passport fees , a measure that would normally pass without debate .
but home office minister baroness williams insisted it was not a chance `` to ask random questions '' .

documents.title: minister hails unifying role of the commonwealthcommonwealth heads of government meeting 2018
text: foreign office minister lord ahmad of wimbledon says the government has underlined the importance of delivery during the time of the uk 's upcoming time in office as chair of the commonwealth .
lord ahmad hails the `` important role of civil society '' as a part of the `` three pillars of the commonwealth '' , observing that it it bridges gaps between communities , races and member states .

parliamentary authorities have granted permission to organise an event to host parliamentarians from across the commonwealth in parliament in april , and he announces that the speakers of both houses are now willing to host them .
`` our chair in office will be defined by how we co-operate , '' he states .
author: House of Lords
Parliament

documents.title: emphasise civil society - labourcommonwealth heads of government meeting 2018
text: shadow foreign office minister lord collins of highbury says that civil society , from churches , to trade unions , remain an important part of democratic life .
although the un 's sustainable development goals top the agenda at this year 's meeting , he asks for a greater emphasis on role of civil society .
he points out that consensual same-sex relationships continue to be rejected in 36 commonwealth countries , which he describes as a `` hangover from british colonial rule '' .
he adds that too many women , disabled people and minorities are still marginalised in commonwealth countries .
author: House of Lords
Parliament

documents.title: uk committed to attracting 'brightest and best'nhs and brexit
text: health minister stephen barclay says there is `` consensus across the house '' as to how valued the nhs 's non british staff are .
he says that those worrying about eu staff leaving the nhs after brexit ignore that there are now 3,200 more eu staff working in the nhs now than there were at the time of the eu referendum .
he adds that the government is committed to attracting the `` brightest and the best '' to come to britain to work from around the world , not just the eu .

but he says the government is also committed to expanding the uk workforce of the nhs , referencing the announcement of new medical schools in lincoln , lancashire , sunderland , chelmsford and canterbury .
author: Westminster Hall

documents.title: labour : wrong deal 'extremely damaging ' to nhsnhs and brexit
text: shadow health minister justin madders says `` the wrong deal or no deal at all will be extremely damaging for the nhs '' .
making reference to the lack of pro-brexit voices in today 's debate he says there 's a `` lack of ownership , lack of candour , lack of realism '' among those who advocated a vote to leave .
he says his party is concerned at the number of eu citizens who work in the nhs who say they are considering leaving .
added to the gaps there already are in nhs recruitment , he says , it is an `` extremely worrying position '' .
he calls on the government to guarantee the right to stay in the uk to eu citizens after brexit .
author: Westminster Hall

documents.title: 'collective amnesia ' by labour on the 2008 crash - ministereconomy debate
text: treasury minister robert jenrick says that there is `` collective amnesia '' about the failures of the last labour government .
he adds that ms dodds ' constituency has benefited hugely from government investment in oxfordshire .
he says the former international development secretary priti patel `` invoked the spirit of mrs thatcher '' to set out a vision of renewal for britain after brexit .
he says that the best market the uk has ever known is the uk 's own single market - scotland , wales , england and northern ireland .
mr jenrick adds that the uk has been `` living within its means , '' in order to create jobs needed and has hosted inward investment where necessary .
debt is now forecast at 1 % lower than the autumn budget figure , he says , and foreign direct investment in the uk is third in the world after the us and china .
he says labour `` have learnt nothing '' from the last few years and would destroy fiscal credibility the uk now has .
`` nothing matters more to our constituents than the security of a job , '' he states , adding that there are three million more jobs than there were in 2010 .
author: House of Commons
Parliament

documents.title: the uk was not 'all in this together ' - laboureconomy debate
text: anneliese dodds , shadow treasury minister , says that in 2010 , the then chancellor george osborne said that `` we are all in this together '' .
she says that eight years on , people now know the opposite is true .

people 's living standards continue to fall , she says , and last week the current chancellor philip hammond hailed the figures as a turning point but public sector borrowing is still higher than forecast a year ago .
she says it is `` not talking britain down '' to point out that the uk is headed for slower than expected growth in 2020 and 2021 .
when labour left office the economy was growing , she says , with the second quarter of 2010 the fastest growing since 2008 .
but since then , she says , the uk is now the slowest growing country in the g7 .
she states that the labour party is actually being optimistic , by looking at poor growth figures , and saying that britain can do better .
she says , according to her estimates , that the government has lost £ 2.2bn by failing to deal with scottish limited partnerships .
she says she has `` lost count '' of the number of business leaders who have spoken to her about the `` lack of grip '' the government has on the brexit process .
author: House of Commons
Parliament

documents.title: 'nothing to be gained ' from brexit for nhsnhs and brexit
text: lib dem tom brake is emphasising the lop-sided nature of today 's debate .
he says `` the minister will be alone in trying to find some silver lining in the brexit cloud '' because `` none of his supporters have turned up '' .
so far the debate has been almost entirely anti-brexit mps .
the only contribution so far that suggested there would be pros from brexit , from conservative david tredinnick , centred on the opportunities presented for alternative medicine .
tom brake says the lack of argument from the pro-brexit side shows there is `` nothing to be gained from brexit '' for the nhs .
author: Westminster Hall

documents.title: debate topic changed to russia for mondaynational security and russia
text: andrea leadsom , leader of the house , pops into the commons chamber to intervene in the ongoing debate on the economy .
she announces that the topic of the general debate on monday has been changed to `` national security and russia '' .
the debate will take place after digital , culture media and sport questions and attorney general questions .
it may also be affected by any potential urgent questions or statements made on the day .
author: House of Commons
Parliament

documents.title: time for passport wavingparliamentary reporter tweets
text: it 's been a while since someone waved their passport in the commons .
conservative mp giles watling ( clacton ) , your time is now
who played the vicar oswald in sitcom bread
good trivia !
from prime-time tv , to guy waving passport on parliament tv
joining soon to the avengers , giles watling is passport man

documents.title: eu/uk recognition of medical qualifications 'crucial'nhs and brexit
text: the snp 's dr lisa cameron says the nhs is `` fundemental to our values '' and `` the bedrock of our society '' .
she asks if the government intends to maintain mutual recognition of medical qualifications with the eu after brexit .
she says it is `` crucial '' so the uk can continue to attract high quality doctors and nurses .

`` brexit seems like a hypothetical thing far in the distance , but as soon as you home in on what it means in partical terms '' , especially when the nhs is mentioned , she says , `` it starts to move to the front of their minds '' .
author: Westminster Hall

documents.title: tory mp defends tendering of blue passporteconomy debate
text: shadow chief secretary to the treasury peter dowd intervenes on tory clacton mp giles watling whilst he is making a series of points about how the brexit `` dividend '' should be spent .
if he were to travel to france , he asks , should he be able to take with him his `` new blue passport that is made in britain , or made in france ?
removing his own passport from a jacket pocket , mr watling replies that he is `` proud of my passport , which i carry here today '' .
`` if it 's blue , let 's make sure we get the best value for money in printing the things '' , he adds .
in response to a follow-up from peter dowd , he replies that `` we have to get the best deal possible '' .
author: House of Commons
Parliament

documents.title: mps debate the nhs and brexitnhs and brexit
text: mps in westminster hall are taking part in a debate on the effect of brexit on the nhs .
labour 's ben bradshaw is introducing the debate .
he says he has three concerns about the possibility of a no-deal scenario for the nhs .
he says that a no-deal would see a `` seizing up '' of medical supply chains and what is most concerning is the potential effect of any sort of import delays .
britain imports radioisotopes , he says , and these are `` time critical '' .
he says he also worries about the `` hemorrhaging '' of eu national nhs staff .
he says at the `` current rate of loss there will be no eu midwives left in the uk at the end of the decade '' and asks for government assurances that the flow of eu staff to the nhs wo n't suffer .
he also says he is worried about the potential damage to the pharmaceutical industry , one of the `` most successful sectors '' of the economy .
author: Westminster Hall

documents.title: watch : lords row over passports made abroadbbc parliament tweets
text: there 's a row in the lords as leaver and remainer peers team up to challenge a minister on reports that uk passports will be made abroad .
watch :

documents.title: economy is about people , not figures - snpeconomy debate
text: snp treasury spokeswoman alison thewliss says the economy is about `` people '' , not `` figures '' .
she says that people feel less in control over their own lives , and like they are `` tiny cogs in a huge machine '' .
the `` precarious '' state of employment and poor provision of benefits confounds this problem , she adds .
corporate executives `` run away with lots and lots of cash '' and the uk continues to build complicated layers of tax bills which allow people to exploit loopholes , she says .
author: House of Commons
Parliament

documents.title: patel : 'growth has been steady and sustainable'economy debate
text: former international development secretary priti patel says growth has been `` steady and sustainable , '' adding that in her constituency the number of enterprises has increased 70 % since 2010 .
she calls for the government to open up `` new markets to consumers '' .
she pays tribute to former prime minister margaret thatcher for `` putting control back in the hands of consumers and the public '' .
the government `` must continue to bang the drum '' for british business and trade , she says , and brexit must be a new period of `` renewal '' for britain .
author: House of Commons
Parliament

documents.title: from cheese puns to tigger parliamentary reporter tweets
text: hard to keep up with shadow chief secretary to the treasury peter dowd who in the last 10mins has lurched from cheese puns to explaining what tigger 's role in winne the pooh was you guessed it , he 's giving a speech on the economy

documents.title: 'her words ring untrue ' - laboureconomy debate
text: for vast parts of the country `` her words ring untrue , '' shadow treasury minister peter dowd says .
he says that last year the uk 's economic growth was the slowest in the g7 and g12 , while also having the highest inflation of those countries .
the economy will now be 3 % smaller in 2021 than projected , he states , and the last decade has been the weakest for wage growth in two centuries after adjustment for inflation .
`` the reality is that the government 's bluster and bravado is fooling no one , '' he says .
the government has missed every deficit target they have ever set , he adds .
public sector debt is £ 700bn higher than it was when the government came to power in 2010 , he states .
and he accuses the government of acting like it is on a `` zero hours contract '' after being `` propped up by the dup '' and with no legislative agenda .
he says that the government should focus on lifting the public sector pay cap `` right across the board '' .
author: House of Commons
Parliament

documents.title: minister quotes amy winehouseparliamentary reporter tweets
text: opening commons debate on the economy , liz truss has quoted amy winehouse : back to black .
yes really .

documents.title: mps start debate on the economyeconomy debate
text: mps move on to a general debate about the economy .
liz truss , chief secretary to the treasury , says that it is now ten years since people were worried about their jobs , their finances and the banks .
`` we are seeing the positive signs of an economy that has recovered , '' she says .
manufacturing has seen the longest consecutive period of growth in liverpool , cardiff and bristol , she adds , and investment and economic growth are being encouraged across the uk .
`` it is not by accident that we have got here , '' she says , `` we have reached this turning point '' because the government has followed a sound economic plan , she states .
the uk now has record numbers of people studying maths and science and moving on to university , she says .
`` labour have no idea what makes britain successful , '' she says and it is trying to `` close down the old economy '' by taking control of certain companies .
she calls it `` an unprecedented encroachment of the government into the private sector '' .
author: House of Commons
Parliament

documents.title: hotels for former residents are 'absolutely intolerable ' - hammersmith mpgrenfell statement
text: labour 's andy slaughter , who represents the neighbouring constituency of hammersmith , says that he has seen many of the hotels where families are still receiving temporary accommodation from rbkc , as they are in his constituency .
he calls them `` budget hotels '' .
`` for a family to be in those conditions for nine months is absolutely intolerable , '' he states .
it is not acceptable for the government to say that they are progressing at the pace that residents want to go .
`` kensington and chelsea are not up to this job '' he says , urging the government to intervene .
mr javid says that of those 82 families in hotels , the vast majority have already accepted permanent or temporary accommodation .
he says many families still have not moved because they 've been asked `` about what furniture they would like . ''
he adds that these people need to be treated as individuals `` and not some simple statistic '' .
author: House of Commons
Parliament

documents.title: javid : emma dent coad 'confused about the numbers'grenfell tower statement
text: sajid javid tells emma dent coad that `` she 's a bit confused about the numbers '' , and suggests that she is `` confusing individuals with households '' .
as for the state of the properties on offer , the communities secretary `` invites '' her to go and investigate them for herself .
he urges her to `` respect '' the fact that today 's report is by an independent task-force , not from the government or the council .
he adds : `` i hope she can come to respect the work of the task-force . ''
author: House of Commons
Parliament

documents.title: labour mp questions government households figuregrenfell tower statement
text: grenfell tower is in the constituency of labour mp emma dent coad , who says she is `` always confused '' about figures cited by the communities secretary because `` we have completely different figures '' .
last november , she says , `` we were told there were 209 displaced households '' but she has `` true figures '' from the council housing department of 376 .
she adds : `` since then , they go through the media comms department where they are put on hot wash and spin '' .
she goes on to challenge the idea that there are three hundred `` fabulous properties '' , saying they are not `` suitable '' .
she continues : `` just this week , i was contacted by two single parents .
one is self harming and is not getting any help .
one is in temporary accommodation riddled with black mould .
`` i am absolutely disgusted , as you may gather . ''
author: House of Commons
Parliament

documents.title: passports row in the lordspassport ( fees ) regulations 2018
text: the lords are asked to approve a statutory instrument ( si ) on passport fees - normally something which would pass without debate .
but labour 's lord foulkes of cumnock uses it as an opportunity to raise the news that blue passports associated with brexit will be made in france , describing it as `` a great embarrassment '' .
home office minister baroness williams tells him it 's not a chance `` to ask random questions '' .
peers take exception to being told they ca n't raise this .
unusually , they try to force a vote on the si - but they eventually back down after a stern intervention from the chief whip .
author: House of Lords
Parliament

documents.title: snp mp : private tenants footing bill for re-claddinggrenfell statement
text: the snp 's alison thewliss says private sector residents are now having to foot the bill for the re-cladding of their own buildings , and asks for sajid javid to make a statement about it .
there needs to be a comprehensive approach to smoke , co2 and heat detectors , she adds .
mr javid replies that `` work continues '' on the issue of fire doors , and that taking those doors and testing them at the same time is a big undertaking .
he says the scottish government is free to work on its own private sector buildings where inappropriate cladding has been found .
`` all this needs review '' in light of the grenfell fire , he states .
author: House of Commons
Parliament

documents.title: labour 'right ' to question speed of rehousing - javidgrenfell statement
text: communities secretary sajid javid says that tony lloyd is `` right '' to question the speed of rehousing .
right from the start , it was the intention to treat each person as an individual , he states , and the council has worked with each individual household affected .
of 208 households offered accommodation , 22 have not accepted any offer of accommodation , despite the fact that there are over 300 properties from which they can choose , he states .
`` no family should be forced into accommodation that they are not comfortable with , '' he adds .
mr javid says he has confidence in the council but `` would like to see more '' .
there are 301 buildings where the government believes that cladding may not be up to safety standards and the government has taken steps to ensure that residents feel safe , he says .
he adds that 130 of these buildings are in the private sector , with work completed on seven .
an independent report is still ongoing , which is why building regulations are still under review by the government , he tells mps .
author: House of Commons
Parliament

documents.title: labour : 'this is a shameful record nine months on'grenfell statement
text: labour 's shadow housing minister tony lloyd says what has been lacking is `` zeal '' from the local authority - the royal borough of kensington and chelsea - in dealing with the problem .
but he does n't doubt the empathy of the council workers on the front line .
`` two hundred and nine families needed rehousing , '' mr lloyd says .
had the prime minister said it would take nine months to get to this point , he says , the idea would have been `` laughed out of the chamber '' .
he adds : `` this is a shameful record nine months on . ''
he asks if the secretary of state has confidence in the council `` to deliver '' and when mr javid will take responsibility himself for what the council has done .
he states that if people are being offered good enough accommodation they would not be turning it down .
he asks when the government is going to make progress on other tower blocks on which cladding has not passed safety tests .
author: House of Commons
Parliament

documents.title: exclude nhs from us-uk trade deal , peer urgesoral questions
text: labour 's lord brooke of alverthorpe asks if us companies will be allowed to bid for nhs contracts as part of any future uk-us trade deal .
he says he has been assured the nhs will be vigorously protected , but the `` most vigorous protection would be not to have it on the agenda at all '' .

trade minister viscount younger of leckie tells him the nhs continues to consider any overseas organisation `` provided the highest standards are met '' and private companies are not guaranteed a right to bid through free trade agreements .
`` protecting the nhs is of utmost importance , '' he stresses , and decisions will be made by the uk and not trade partners .
conservative lord forsyth of drumlean says this would have arisen anyway through ttip and the `` glory of brexit is that we will be able to decide for ourselves '' .
lib dem lord purvis of tweed observes that if this were a deal with the eu the scope would have been published and it 's `` unacceptable '' not to know what 's covered .
the minister replies the government 's commitment to transparency on trade is `` there in writing '' and he `` should be reassured '' .
author: House of Lords
Parliament

documents.title: 'progress has not been made as quickly as it should have done ' - javidgrenfell statement
text: housing , communities and local government secretary sajid javid says the second report from the independent task force will be published on the government website shortly .
he says he remains confident that the police and ongoing investigation will provide the answers people seek .
he thanks the task force for taking over from a `` slow and confused initial response '' to support people to recover and rebuild their lives .
there is more to be done to ensure that residents `` see and feel things are getting better on the ground '' , mr javid says .
he goes on to say that today 188 households have accepted an offer of accommodation , two thirds of these have already moved into new accommodation , and 62 into permanent homes .
`` progress has not been made as quickly as it should have done , '' he states .
it is unlikely that all households will have been permanently housed by the first anniversary of the fire , he says , `` this is clearly not good enough '' .
he says : `` living for this long in hotels can only make the process of grieving and recovery even longer . ''
author: House of Commons
Parliament

documents.title: grenfell tower statement
text: the communities secretary sajid javid is making one his regular statements updating mps about grenfell tower .
two days ago it was reported that nearly £ 21m has been spent keeping grenfell tower survivors in hotel rooms .
more than nine months after the fire which killed 71 , 62 families have moved into permanent homes and 82 are still in emergency accommodation .
the council says it is doing everything it can to re-house survivors .
it added it bought hundreds of new homes to offer `` maximum choice '' .

documents.title: press review will not be required to hold meetings in publicoral questions
text: labour spokesman lord stevenson of balmacara asks whether the recently launched review of press sustainability in the united kingdom will have the power to call for evidence and whether evidence and meetings which form part of the review will be public .

government spokesman lord keen of elie says it will be led by an external chair - dame frances cairncross - and will not be a statutory inquiry so will not have the powers to require witnesses to appear nor be required to hold meetings in public .
lord stevenson says he hopes the chair will see the wisdom of doing that as he finds the review `` oddly framed '' and asks that it should be allowed to report on social media .
lord keen confirms social media will be included .
author: House of Lords
Parliament

documents.title: leadsom : tories 'never employed ' cambridge analyticabusiness statement
text: the snp 's pete wishart says recent revelations about facebook data get `` murkier and murkier '' and asks for a statement from the prime minister on the `` full scale of the government 's connections to cambridge analytica '' .
he says a shareholder in scl group , cambridge analytica 's parent company , is a major conservative party donor .
leader of the house andrea leadsom says the conservative party `` never employed cambridge analytica nor its parent company , nor used its services '' .
author: House of Commons
Parliament

documents.title: government 'looking carefully ' at magnitsky clausebusiness statement
text: the shadow leader of the house valerie vaz notes the lack of votes in the commons this week .
`` it 's not as if the government has no business '' she says , asking why the government 's planned bills on customs , trade and sanctions and money laundering have all disappeared .

she says the disappearance of the sanctions and anti-money laundering bill is particularly puzzling given the government 's apparent support for a `` magnitsky clause '' that they previously voted down .
magnitsky laws , named after a russian lawyer who died in custody , are intended to limit russian officials ' access to corruptly obtained money held outside the country .
a number of other countries , including the united states , have such laws on the books .
leader of the house andrea leadsom says the government is `` looking carefully '' at the magnitsky legislation , and is making sure it will be as `` strong as possible '' .
author: House of Commons
Parliament

documents.title: mps to debate russia on mondaybusiness statement
text: the leader of the house is outlining future business in the commons .
next week there 'll be a general debate on russia on monday , and debate on the financial guidance and claims bill on tuesday , she tells mps .
this will be followed by opposition day debates on local government and police funding on wednesday , followed by debate on a motion on autism on thursday .
on the first monday after easter , mps will consider the laser misuse ( vehicles ) bill , which has already gone through the house of lords .
author: House of Commons
Parliament

documents.title: labour : cambridge analytica a 'malign octopus'digital , culture , media and sport questions
text: shadow culture minister liam byrne is the first person in the chamber to raise the cambridge analytica facebook data scandal .
he says the `` network '' of firms linked to `` this malign octopus '' must be understood .
he claims that some companies linked to cambridge analytica are being `` assembled '' by the government for a `` secretive weekend somewhere in the countryside on saturday '' .
culture secretary matt hancock replies that there were government contracts in the past with this group of companies but `` no ongoing arrangements '' with cambridge analytica or its group .
liam byrne says cambridge analytica has `` many individual and arrangements with other firms '' and that he hopes the minister will `` reflect on his answer '' .
he also says the episode has revealed that the information commissioner `` does not have the power '' needed .
matt hancock says that the government 's data protection bill will `` strengthen '' protections and that he did n't to be `` partisan '' , but weak powers are a result of labour 's time in office .
author: House of Commons
Parliament

documents.title: ministers working 'closely ' with england teamdigital , culture , media and sport questions
text: mps are now asking questions to ministers from the department for digital , culture , media and sport .
labour 's clive efford up on a parliamentary theme from yesterday , the upcoming football world cup in russia .
he asks what 's being done to `` minimise '' opportunities for russia to use the world cup for propaganda purposes .
sports minister tracey crouch says it 's `` understandable '' that a country hosting a tournament wants to announce it with a `` fanfare '' .
the government is working `` closely '' with the football association to provide help on security matters for the england team and for fans , she adds .
author: House of Commons
Parliament

documents.title: westminster attack marked
text: mps observe a minute 's silence to mark the first anniversary of the westminster bridge terror attack .
four people were killed when an islamist terrorist drove into pedestrians on westminster bridge .
the attacker then entered the parliamentary estate , stabbing a police officer to death before being shot dead by armed police .
author: House of Commons
Parliament

documents.title: today in the house of commons
text: today , the commons starts with a minute 's silence to mark the one year anniversary of the terror attack on westminster bridge and at the houses of parliament .
after that mps will put questions to ministers from the digital , culture , media and sport department .
subjects due to be raised by mps include sport on terrestrial television , support for tourism and superfast broadband .
following the announcement of future business in the commons , the housing and communities secretary sajid javid will give mps an update on the grenfell tower disaster .
the main business of the day is a debate on the economy .
author: House of Commons
Parliament

documents.title: summary : wednesday in parliament
text: foreign secretary boris johnson generated headlines this afternoon during a question and answer session with mps on the foreign affairs committee .
during exchanges on russia , mps raised concerns about the safety of fans travelling to russia to watch the world cup in june .
labour mp ian austin said he thought england should withdraw from the event and warned that president putin would use this in the way hitler used the 1936 olym
mr johnson agreed , saying that mr austin was completely right '' .

before that , council funding was the main topic at prime minister 's questions , as jeremy corbyn accused theresa may of presiding over cuts and she said council tax was higher under labour-controlled authorities .
in the lords , the government said it would withdraw its current amendments to the eu withdrawal bill on devolution , which had been decried as a `` power grab '' .

documents.title: future of devolution is 'not a question of trust'eu withdrawal bill
text: government spokesman lord keen reiterates that if peers attempt to remodel the constitution in this bill it will `` sink without a trace '' .

if the uk is to have a single market , we `` require a body to have jurisdiction over that single market '' , he tells the house , and deciding which areas fall within that body 's competence is `` not an issue of trust but constitutional propriety '' .
he warns that if devolved administrations insist on their consent being required for these decisions , that is `` the basis for what has been termed the veto problem '' .
he hails the progress being made and withdraws the government 's amendments .
shortly after that , the lords adjourns for the night .
author: House of Lords
Parliament

documents.title: labour sounds sympathetic to lord mackay amendmenteu withdrawal bill
text: winding up this evening 's debate for labour , lord stevenson of balmacara tells peers the question of how to maintain devolution after brexit `` need more discussion than can go into this bill '' .

he says what he wants ultimately is for the bill to reflect the `` underlying principle that everything devolved unless it is reserved '' and a `` clear explanation '' of why something is considered reserved .
`` there must not be a sense that something is hidden or held back , '' he cautions .
he says that lord mackay 's amendment on a new group of representatives of the four parts of the uk `` has got something there '' .
author: House of Lords
Parliament

documents.title: government to withdraw devolution amendmentseu withdrawal bill
text: the government will withdraw its own amendments at the end of the debate to enable the administration `` to reflect seriously on the points made '' and include them in future talks , lord keen told the lords earlier .
he said they had been produced in response to the concerns raised over the existing proposals and `` represent a substantial movement from our original position '' .
author: House of Lords
Parliament

documents.title: 'who will speak for england ? 'eu withdrawal bill
text: conservative lord forsyth of drumlean strikes a note of dissent on lord mackay 's proposal , arguing this is a bill concerning repatriation of powers from brussels and `` not a bill to remodel the constitution '' .
he asks , in the representative group suggested by lord mackay , `` who will speak for england ? ''
author: House of Lords
Parliament

documents.title: meanwhile in edinburgh and cardiffbbc political correspondent tweets
text: scottish parliament and welsh assembly have both passed their own brexit bills tonight to try and ensure powers go back automatically .
both still hoping they wo n't be needed and agreement can be reached on uk legislation .
i doubt if we can depend on the uk goverment to agree with the devolved governments .
devolved zgovernments or as tories prefer to call them the colonies
both given up hope that agreement can be reached on uk legislation
hi nick .
is there a link to an depth piece from you on this on # gms today ?
heard your odyssey from brussels but this important development seems to be getting little coverage
in scotland it is a bill that enshrines scots sovereign rights as signed in the 1707 act of union .
independence is not far away .
udi will be the only course
take out 'to try ' not required in your statement

documents.title: lib dem peer calls for sunset clauseeu withdrawal bill
text: lib dem lord wallace of tankerness acknowledges the government has sought to reassure the devolved administrations that its exercise of power on devolved matters is temporary , but points out there 's `` no actual sunset clause '' .
he suggests this should be added .

he also welcomes lord mackay 's suggestion of a group to decide which devolved areas are covered by the framework for a single market , as this is the type of `` thinking outside the box '' which is needed .
author: House of Lords
Parliament

documents.title: proposal for new group to take decisions on devolution and the single marketeu withdrawal bill
text: conservative lord mackay of clashfern says that as setting up a single market covers the whole of the uk it is `` common sense '' this will need to be managed on a uk-wide basis .
but he notes it will be `` highly desirable to get agreement of the component parts '' and therefore proposes a group consisting of representatives of all four countries .
the group would decide which of the devolved areas of competence to include in a framework document enabling a single market to be set up in those areas in the united kingdom .
author: House of Lords
Parliament

documents.title: labour condemns limits on westminster 's powers as 'too weak'eu withdrawal bill
text: labour spokesman lord griffiths of burry port describes the original drafting of the bill as an `` emasculation '' of devolution .
he acknowledges efforts to address this , but warns there is `` some way to go '' before the government 's proposals become satisfactory .

he says the amendments under discussion give westminster `` very wide unilateral powers '' to restrict how the devolved legislatures operate and ministers have `` tried to throw sand in our eyes '' by publishing details of a raft of areas where uk-wide frameworks are needed .
the safeguards offered are `` far too weak '' , he argues .
author: House of Lords
Parliament

documents.title: government pledges 'no encroachment ' on devolutioneu withdrawal bill
text: government spokesman lord keen of elie introduces the government 's amendment , which would place restrictions on westminster 's ability to exercise powers returning from brussels after brexit where those relate to devolved matters .
he stresses the bill `` must work for whole uk '' and the government is `` sincere '' in this commitment .
he says most powers would pass directly to devolved nations and would only go to westminster in `` specific areas where a framework will be needed for the whole uk '' .
he insists there 'll be `` no encroachment '' on devolution , and the bill applies only to the extent that the powers in question are covered by eu law .
author: House of Lords
Parliament

documents.title: peers launch into scrutiny of devolution after brexiteu withdrawal bill
text: peers now resume their committee-stage debate on the eu withdrawal bill , focusing on the government 's amendments on devolution .

under the current bill , without the amendments , powers in devolved areas that are currently wielded at eu level , such as agricultural support are set to return to westminster rather than cardiff , edinburgh and belfast .
the amendments to the bill come after months of talks between the welsh , scottish and uk governments .
uk ministers announced a list of powers that they would retain at a uk level , for a temporary period , including food labelling and agricultural support .
votes on this are not expected today , but the debate gives an idea of how the government 's plans will be received .
author: House of Lords
Parliament

documents.title: 'the devil is in the detail ' - liberal democrats
text: liberal democrat baroness jolly says `` the devil is in the detail , '' and that in her experience of working in a primary care trust in 2004 it was very difficult to get all different branches of nhs staff around the same table to discuss matters .
she asks if care workers salaries will be included in the green paper on social care .

lord o'shaughnessy says it is important to pay tribute to all organisations that have been involved in striking this deal , `` it is a true partnership , '' which is `` trying to work for everybody '' .
he adds that pay progression will be linked to skill levels .
the intention is to move away from automatic progression to pay based on skill .
he adds that this works better for patients but also puts the onus on employers to make sure that there is proper professional development of their staff .
author: House of Lords
Parliament

documents.title: 'really rather too little , too late ' - labournhs pay urgent question repeat
text: shadow health minister baroness thornton says that this is `` really rather too little , too late , '' adding that the pay restraint in the past eight years has meant that staff have received a 14 % pay cut .
she asks if the government will now pursue a `` joined up '' health and social care approach .
she says that the nhs is still short of around 100,000 staff .
lord o'shaughnessy says there is a genuine willingness in the government to ensure that there is a `` joined up '' approach to health and social care .
he says the government is able to put more money into the nhs due to `` good economic stewardship '' .
author: House of Lords
Parliament

documents.title: lords hear statement on nhs paynhs pay statement
text: health and social care minister lord o'shaughnessy is repeating as a statement the answer to an earlier urgent question asked by shadow health secretary jonathan ashworth .
the statement says that today 's agreement on a new pay deal reflects the public appreciation of nhs staff following a challenging winter .
the lowest starting salary in the nhs will increase by over £ 2500 .
other changes include buying and selling annual leave as well as shared parental leave for nhs staff .
health and social care secretary jeremy hunt told mps : `` rarely has a pay rise been so well deserved for nhs staff . ''
author: House of Lords
Parliament

documents.title: boris johnson 's world cup remarks attract attention
text: boris johnson 's remarks to the foreign affairs committee - reported on our live page this afternoon - comparing the world cup in putin 's russia to the 1936 olym in nazi germany are attracting considerable attention .
the foreign secretary agreed that president putin is using the world cup in russia as a `` pr exercise '' akin to how hitler used the 1936 olym
labour mp ian austin put it to boris johnson that the russian president wanted to `` gloss over [ his ] brutal corrupt regime '' .
mr johnson replied : `` i 'm afraid that 's completely right , completely right . ''

documents.title: mini-row as lords adjournpa reporter tweets
text: bit of a mini-row going on over adjourning @ twitterid until 6pm
resolved .
lord wigley heard to say 'let it go '

documents.title: parakilas : technology poses 'huge challenges for democracy'digital , culture , media and sport committee
text: another labour mp , julie elliott , asks mr parakilas whether the way facebook works is posing a `` challenge '' to democracy .
`` i think it 's creating huge challenges for democracy '' , he replies - although adding that `` it 's not a facebook-specific problem '' .
the amount of data technology companies hold means voters can be `` manipulated using that data '' , he adds .
author: Select Committee
Parliament

documents.title: getting robust in the lordsbbc parliament reporter tweets
text: things getting a bit robust between plaid 's lord wigley and govt spokesman lord keen
that is quite a stern point !
is n't it !
you 've got to love a parliament where you can hear the words `` no forgive me archbishop but i must respond to his point ``
wow .
total lack of awareness that england 's greater size ( not to mention lack of any snp or sf peers ) means uk house of lords is effectively an english legislature .

documents.title: facebook users 'should be informed ' of data usedigital , culture , media and sport committee
text: labour mp jo stevens asks what `` potential questions '' committee members should ask mark zuckerberg if he accepts their invitation to give evidence .
sandy parakilas say that he will provide them with a list of potential questions privately .
following up , ms stevens asks whether facebook users whose data has been passed to cambridge analytica should be notified .
they should `` absolutely '' be informed , he replies .
he adds that facebook should be able to figure out a close estimation of who has been affected .
author: Select Committee
Parliament

documents.title: fishing deal protest outside parliament
text: fishing deal protest outside parliament

documents.title: labour mp questions facebook profits from politicsdigital , culture , media and sport committee
text: labour 's ian lucas asks whether it is the case that facebook is making `` huge amounts of money '' from targeted political advertising .
mr parakilas says the reported `` tens of millions of dollars '' spent during the us presidential election would have gone direct to facebook .
author: Select Committee
Parliament

documents.title: bill on reducing mla pay progresses to the lordsnorthern ireland mlas pay
text: after broad agreement from across the house , northern ireland minister shailesh vara says that it remains the government 's overriding priority to see devolution restored .
the ongoing payment of full salaries to mlas is a matter of public concern , he states .
the bill will allow ministers to make changes to pay and allowances for the current period , he says .

`` we are now at a point where we simply can not go on paying mlas at their current full salary , '' he states , `` the measures in this bill are necessary and proportionate , in the interests of public finances , public services and public confidence '' in northern ireland .
with that , the bill is approved and will proceed to the lords .
author: House of Commons
Parliament

documents.title: keeping an eye on boris johnsonbbc parliament journalist tweets
text: ian austin asks why , every time boris johnson appears before the committee , the pm 's pps is sent along to keep an eye on him .
foreign sec : `` i think it 's an honour ''
more to the point , do the labour party send someone along to keep an eye on ian austin ?
i 'm not allowed to .
practice ?
- for his forthcoming promotion ?

documents.title: snp mp : was this a 'data breach ' ? digital , culture , media and sport committee
text: the snp 's brendan o'hara asks whether the reported passing of facebook data to cambridge analytica constitutes a `` data breach '' or a `` failure of procedure '' .
sandy parakilas says he ca n't give a legal opinion , but says that as far as facebook users are concerned the effects would be the same .
users had `` no idea that had happened '' he says - and facebook itself `` did n't notify anyone '' .
`` arguing over whether it 's a data breach or not really is n't the point '' , he adds .

documents.title: devolved bodies 'have not responded to westminster request'eu withdrawal bill
text: government spokesperson baroness goldie underlines her belief in `` respect for devolution settlements '' and says ministers do not oppose the idea of delegated powers being used by holyrood and cardiff bay .

she refers to this as `` sub-delegation '' and tells peers `` we 've invited devolved administrations to give examples [ of areas where they would seek this ] but so far no examples have been given '' .
lord hope suggests use of the term `` sub-delegation '' reveals how the government really views devolution , but nonetheless withdraws his amendment .
author: House of Lords
Parliament

documents.title: uk urging 'every possible restraint ' on turkeyforeign affairs committee
text: labour 's mike gapes asks about the syrian city of afrin , siezed by a turkish led operation from kurdish milita .
activists says hundreds of civilians were killed in the fighting .
he says another city , manbij is also under threat .
he asks what is being said by the uk to turkey , who are `` our nato ally '' .
boris johnson says the turn of events in northern syria is `` appalling '' but that `` everyone understands turkey 's anxieties about the pkk '' .
turkey says the kurdish ypg militias in syria are linked to the pkk , recognised as terrorists by the eu .
he says the `` conflict is dragging away from the fight against daesh , it 's a very , very difficult situation '' .
labour 's ann clwyd accuses the turks of `` using '' the kurds in the fight against is and then turning on them .
boris johnson says he 's `` urging our turkish allies to use every possible restraint in what they 're doing '' .
author: Select Committee
Parliament

documents.title: 'little enforcement ' of anti-sharing policiesdigital , culture , media and sport committee
text: conservative mp julian knight asks whether app developers were using personal profile data `` exclusively to target advertising '' .
sandy parakilas replies that there were a `` number of rules '' in facebook 's policies that tried to prevent developers passing data to advertising networks .
however he adds there was `` very little detection or enforcement '' .
he goes on to say that that he would n't say the rules were never enforced , but he ca n't remember a `` specific instance '' of enforcement during his time there .
facebook , he says , should be `` more proactive '' in taking legal action against developers .
author: Select Committee
Parliament

documents.title: mlas want to be active in their communities - dupnorthern ireland mlas pay
text: the dup 's gavin robinson says that all parties in northern ireland would like to have a functioning assembly in northern ireland tomorrow .
these people `` want to be active within their communities and to get on with the job , '' he states .
he asks if powers in this bill would be available after the assembly is reformed .
mrs bradley replies that even if an executive is formed again , and immediately collapses , the power still resides with parliament to reduce mla pay .
mr robinson asks the northern ireland secretary to use the powers in the bill , as soon as possible , to reduce mla pay .
author: House of Commons
Parliament

documents.title: labour 'accept the need to cut mla salaries ' - smithnorthern ireland
text: shadow northern ireland secretary owen smith says that labour `` accept the need to cut mla salaries .
mr smith says that mlas have mortgages , families and it is right that a too large a cut is not taken in one go .
he adds that it is right that the staff of mlas do not face pay cuts , as the current situation is not their fault .
author: House of Commons
Parliament

documents.title: northern ireland secretary takes steps to adjust mla paynorthern ireland debate
text: the northern ireland regional rates and adjustments bill passes through the commons at third reading without any objection .
with that , the commons moves to northern ireland assembly members pay bill .
this was tabled by the commons leader andrea leadsom , yesterday .

it prevents an automatic increase of £ 500 in pay for northern irish members of the legislative assembly which is scheduled to happen on the 1st april unless the secretary of state intervenes using powers in this bill , if approved .
northern ireland secretary karen bradley says it is important that parliament , and not the government , makes decisions on the matter .
she adds that there is `` clear public concern '' on mlas receiving salaries when there has not been a functioning assembly for 14 months .
mrs bradley says that it is apparent from opinion polling that it is something the community wants her to take action on .

she states that she has received advice from trevor reaney , the clerk of the northern ireland assembly , who recommends reducing mla pay by 27.5 % until the functioning executive in northern ireland is resolved .
she says that she is `` minded '' to follow the advice .
she states she will not follow mr reaney 's other advice , which was to also reduce the pay of mlas ' staff because - the says - the situation is not down to them .
owen smith , the shadow northern ireland secretary , says he agrees with her remarks .
author: House of Commons
Parliament

documents.title: ex-judge calls for limit on henry viii powers in devolved matterseu withdrawal bill
text: peers resume committee-stage debate on the eu withdrawal bill , which repeals the european communities act 1972 and writes eu law into uk law ahead of brexit .
committee stage is when peers carry out detailed line-by-line scrutiny of legislation , but amendments are not normally forced to a vote - this happens at report stage .

crossbencher lord hope of craighead , former deputy president of the supreme court , introduces an amendment to ensure powers granted to ministers under the bill to deal by regulation with deficiencies in retained eu law are exercised in scotland and wales where they relate to devolved matters .
he says he is motivated by the `` need to respect devolution settlements in scotland and wales '' and ensure `` returned eu competencies should be distributed according to devolution settlements '' .
author: House of Lords
Parliament

documents.title: were facebook users notified of abuse ? digital , culture , media and sport committee
text: damian collins asks sandy parakilas if he can go into more detail about action taken against developers suspected of misusing data .
specifically , he asks whether facebook users were notified when misuse was identified .
`` not to my knowledge '' , replies mr parakilas .
author: Select Committee
Parliament

documents.title: call for bolder action to tackle pay inequalityoral questions
text: labour 's lord dubs is asking what further action the government will take to reduce gender inequality in pay , arguing `` it 's time to be bold '' and put all income tax receipts into public domain

equalities minister baroness williams tells peers that tackling the gender pay gap `` is part of building a country works for everyone '' and points out the conservatives introduced the requirement for large employers to publish what they pay men and women .
she says publishing receipts would allow people to `` snoop '' on others .
author: House of Lords
Parliament

documents.title: regional rates setting required for northern ireland to provide certainty - ministernorthern ireland debate
text: northern ireland minister shailesh vara says that setting the regional rates will give those living in northern ireland and businesses certainty on what they will have to pay the government for services .
he says the measures being taken are necessary to safeguard public services .
author: House of Commons
Parliament

documents.title: labour is 'as one ' with the northern ireland secretarynorthern ireland debate
text: shadow northern ireland office minister stephen pound says that in westminster today they are talking about something which the commons does not necessarily want to have to discuss .
he states that when you hear stories from the troubles in northern ireland and the ongoing peace process it is a reminder of the importance of not returning to that situation .
listing those who lost loved ones he says that if the commons does not do it 's `` very best '' then it is letting those people down .
he says labour is `` as one '' with the secretary of state on this issue .
author: House of Commons
Parliament

documents.title: parakilas : 'few ways ' to discover data abuse at developersdigital , culture , media and sport committee
text: tory mp and committee chair damian collins asks sandy parakilas how privacy safeguards at facebook worked when he was there .
mr parakilas says facebook developed platform policies in response to the fact that the company lost oversight of data once it was sent to app developers .
the company had `` very few ways '' of discovering abuse once data had been passed on , he tells mps .
in his time at the company , he can not remember a single `` physical audit '' of an outside developer and remembers `` only a handful '' of lawsuits and bans taking place , he says .
author: Select Committee
Parliament

documents.title: who is sandy parakilas ? culture committee
text: mr parakilas had responsibility for investigating data breaches by third-party software developers using facebook between 2011 and 2012 .
earlier this week he told the guardian that facebook discouraged him from auditing outside developers to find out what they were doing with its data .
according to his account , executives at the firm thought it was better not to know '' what external developers were doing with the information .
facebook has said its data sharing practices have significantly improved '' over recent years .

documents.title: boris johnson : world cup like berlin 1936 olym affairs committee
text: labour 's ian austin says he 's a football fan but there 's `` absolutely no way '' he 'd go to russia for the world cup .
he says he 'd fear for his safety given attacks on england fans by organised russian gangs in marseille at the 2016 european championships .
and he says the tournament is a propaganda exercise for vladimir putin , comparing it with nazi germany 's 1936 olym and that he doubts the england team should be going at all .
boris johnson says the `` comparison with 1936 is certainly right , it is an emetic prospect to imagine putin glorying in this sporting event '' .
but he says `` i think on balance it would be wrong to punish [ the fans ] or the team , but your point about the safety of fans is well made and well taken '' .
following the clashes in 2016 a russian nationalist mp praised the russian hooligans saying they were `` defending the honour of their country '' .
author: Select Committee
Parliament

documents.title: home office minister confronted on undercover policingoral questions
text: green peer baroness jones of moulsecoomb asks what communications the government has had over the last 30 years with police forces regarding the tactic of undercover police officers forming sexual relationships to develop their cover stories .
she says there were `` state-sponsored sexual relationships '' between undercover police and innocent women , and `` until we know their names we wo n't know how many they are '' .
she highlights that campaigners today walked out of a public inquiry into undercover policing , demanding that the chairman stand down or appoint a full panel .
home office baroness williams of trafford points out that the inquiry is intended to gauge the state of awareness of the government when it comes to officers ' behaviour .
she says hearings are still ongoing and urges people to participate fully .
labour spokesman lord kennedy of southwark asks if she 's confident the type of behaviour discussed could not happen again .
the minister replies that `` nobody can legislate for the odd rogue undertaking '' but we can put in place `` measures to mitigate it as far as possible '' .
author: House of Lords
Parliament

documents.title: are the uk and russia co-operating on world cup security ? foreign affairs committee
text: labour 's chris bryant asks about uk-russia security co-operation on the upcoming world cup .
he says the uk helped to keep the 2014 sochi winter olym safe , and wonders if the same is happening this time .

boris johnson says the government is `` doing what we can to ensure the safety of england fans going to watch the football '' and says russia has to `` guarantee the safety '' of fans travelling to russia .

he adds that applications to go to the tournament from england fans are `` a quarter '' of what they were in the run-up to the 2014 brazil tournament , with 20,000 applications made for tickets so far , compared to 95,000 last time .
chris bryant says he 's more interested in whether britain has suspended intelligence sharing with russia or not .
boris johnson says he wo n't comment on intelligence matters but `` we are co-operating at a police level '' and there are `` questions '' about how that co-operation will go on .
author: Select Committee
Parliament

documents.title: coming up : mps question former facebook manager
text: over on the committee corridor , mps on the culture committee will shortly be continuing their inquiry into the phenomenon of 'fake news ' .
today , they will be taking evidence from former facebook operations manager sandy parakilas .
it comes amid a growing row about the use of personal facebook data by london-based firm cambridge analytica .
the company has been accused of harvesting the data of millions of facebook users in 2014 without their explicit consent and using it for political profiling in the us .

documents.title: johnson : kremlin 'bitter ' about cold warforeign affairs committee
text: boris johnson is speculating about the mindset of vladimir putin and russia 's leaders .
he says he thinks there 's a `` revanchist bitter feeling '' over how the cold war ended and how `` the boundaries of russia 's dominions have been rolled back '' .
he says he thinks vladimir putin `` feels that very keenly '' .
he says `` his principle audience for this is not us , it 's his domestic audience who want to feel that russia is strong again '' .
committee chair tom tugendhat intervenes to say that `` some of it is meant for us '' and that russian actions and propaganda are meant to `` unwind western alliances '' .
`` so far they 've been wholly confounded in their efforts '' says the foreign secretary .
the reaction to the skripal case has `` re-enforced the solidarity of our continent and of nato '' .
author: Select Committee
Parliament

documents.title: minister rejects calls to put belfast agreement in brexit billeu withdrawal bill
text: northern ireland minister lord duncan of springbank responds by emphasising that the belfast agreement is `` a cornerstone of our policy and so it will remain '' .
he notes that the uk is `` already bound by statute and international treaty '' in this regard .
he says placing the agreement on the face of the bill would put `` a much greater constraint '' on how the legislation relates to northern ireland compared with the rest of the uk .
to this line of argument , lord patten retorts : `` well , what does he think the good friday agreement is ? ''
but he agrees to withdraw his amendment .
author: House of Lords
Parliament

documents.title: 'time to go beyond warm words ' on belfast agreement - laboureu withdrawal bill
text: shadow lords leader baroness smith of basildon expresses labour 's support for putting a commitment to the principles of the belfast agreement on the face of the bill .
she accuses the government of doing `` a hokey-cokey on regulatory alignment '' , which is a matter that is `` profound and deep and has implications for peace process '' .
she continues that the `` lack of detail '' on how the government intends to resolve this issue `` is why it 's become such an issue '' .
`` it 's time to go beyond warm words , '' she urges .
author: House of Lords
Parliament

documents.title: labour : 'troubled ' at making decisions for northern irelandnorthern ireland debate
text: shadow northern ireland secretary owen smith says that the northern ireland secretary is `` right '' to say that this is a modest bill with few substantive measures .

he states that it is also right for the government to continue to cap the renewable heat incentive - it was controversy over the scheme that triggered the collapse of power-sharing in northern ireland .
he adds that it `` troubles '' him that westminster is now having to make some decisions on account of the assembly not being active .
author: House of Commons
Parliament

documents.title: uk russia policy 'unchanged'foreign affairs committee
text: priti patel raises the foreign secretary 's visit to russia in december , where he talked about the need for engagement and dialogue between the uk and russia .
she asks if that is still his approach in light of the skripal case .
boris johnson says the `` policy is effectively unchanged '' and that `` the uk has many admirers among the russian people , many people who want to listen to what we have to say '' .
author: Select Committee
Parliament

documents.title: johnson : russia sending 'a sign ' to potential defectorsforeign affairs committee
text: the committee hearing begins with russia .

boris johnson says the assassination attempt on former double agent sergei skripal was a `` reckless endangering '' of life in the uk and the `` trail of responsibility does lead , inexorably , back [ to russia ] '' .
he rejects a suggestion that it could have been russian agents or ex agents outside vladimir putin 's control , saying `` the chain of responsibility leads to those at the top '' .
labour 's mike gapes asks why russia would have felt able to carry out such a `` brazen '' attack on british soil .

boris johnson says it was a `` message to potential defectors '' and that it was done in britain because `` this is a country that believes in freedom , democracy and the rule of law , and has time and again called out russia over its abuses of those values '' .
he says by using a nerve agent known to have been developed in the soviet union they were sending `` a sign '' that `` no former russian agent was immune '' .
author: Select Committee
Parliament

documents.title: mps debate northern ireland regional ratesnorthern ireland debate
text: the commons moves on to debate funding for northern ireland .
northern ireland secretary karen bradley says that the context in which this bill is being introduced in the 14 month absence of a functioning executive in northern ireland .
she says northern ireland would normally be in charge of its own estimates and budget , but in this case the government must , reluctantly , do this for the region .
this is a result of the government 's commitment to protecting public services and provide good governance in northern ireland .
there are decisions which must ideally be taken by ministers in stormont , but the steps being taken today are necessary , she adds .
she had previously hoped that a new executive would be able to take control of the process , but this will not now be possible before next year 's budget , she states .
author: House of Commons
Parliament

documents.title: mps question boris johnson on foreign affairsforeign affairs committee
text: the foreign secretary boris johnson is in front of the foreign affairs select committee .
the session is likely to be dominated by russia .
britain is still engaged in a diplomatic standoff over the poisoning of the former double agent sergei skripal and his daughter in salisbury .
yesterday 23 russian diplomats returned to moscow having been expelled from the embassy in london in retaliation for an attack the british government believes russia is responsible for .

overnight it emerged that president trump , in a phone call with vladimir putin , congratulated the russian president on his election victory despite being told not to by advisers and failed to mention the skripal case .
author: Select Committee
Parliament

documents.title: calls to improve care for women having ivften minute rule bill
text: labour mp siobhain mcdonagh proposes amending the human fertilisation and embryology act 1990 to improve the welfare of women undergoing treatment to help them conceive .
she says that while the current law requires ivf clinics to take into account the `` welfare of the child '' it ignores the welfare of women .
she says five million children have been conceived , thanks to ivf , but there is `` overhwleming evidence '' that drug protocols can cause women `` extremely adverse health effects '' .
the main problem is ovarian hyperstimulation syndrome , triggered by the over-stimulation of the ovaries .

she says the current legislation does not make any stipulation about the welfare of women so the human fertilisation and embryology authority is unable to monitor the administration of fertility drugs .
author: House of Commons
Parliament
